website_summaries.verdict: Durable and resistant to the elements, this pre-assembled cot offers a large sleeping area.
pros: 100D nylon is more durable than polyester
cons: Not as supportive of shorter/smaller users as some competitors

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy
customer_reviews.text: Just got the cot. Easy to set up. Locked in place. We put a double thick pad on it. Dressed it up with twin sheets and pillows. Fits my 6.4 husband that is 250 lbs with room for him to sleep on his side. He will be using it for 4 nights so then we will see how well it holds up. He was able to take it down quickly and put back in the carrying case it came with. At this time our review is a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Mama D

customer_reviews.title: Success, at last!
customer_reviews.text: As comfortable and easy to put up and take down as I could imagine a camping cot could be. I bought a Lightspeed self-inflating XL pad to put on top. I'm a side sleeper and have back/hip pain. This made camping in a tent bearable. I've tried many different pads, air mattresses and other options and this was the first comfortable nights' sleep I've had in a tent in years.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This cot is great! I bought it to survive Boy Scout camping with my son. It is extremely sturdy and once locked into place doesn't budge. It unfolds like a modern playpen and refills the same way. I am a very heavy person. I am able to lay on it and roll through the night without creaks or groans and there is no fear of something giving way and me smashing to the ground. It actually fits easily into the carry case and that has straps long enough so that you can wear it as a backpack when you are hauling gear. I would buy it again and again but won't need to. This is built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal M. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Material streches after 2 weeks so u sink
customer_reviews.text: I weigh 220in, It seemed good at first. And lasted 2 weeks before the material started to stretch and I started to sink. It stretches where you are heaviest, so your torso ends up being lower than your feet. Very disappointed. In addition, to begin with, the bed is not as taught as the picture makes it seem.
customer_reviews.author: 1wot

customer_reviews.title: Best cot EVER !
customer_reviews.text: Best cot EVER!! It sets up in less than a minute & breaks down & packs away in about 2! I'm 55 & disabled & can use it with ease! It is a great size, I'm over 300# and it's comfortable for me. (might add a Yoga mat or air mat..?) Love it ! !
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'2" 195# - 69yr old and I've camped since the '50's I'm no stranger to tent camping & cots I loved the first one so much, I bought a second I've slept for 5 days on one, and can honestly say I don't remember a thing I woke up with no aches or pains So now I've got 2 kwik cots - And one Kamp-Rite tent cot (which started this all) They're not cheap, but how bout a great night's sleep - I've used them & Love em all
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: and didn't hold up well) - this cot is so superior to them it's crazy
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several cots, (primarily Coleman brand models that cost more than this one, were extremely hard to set up, and didn't hold up well) - this cot is so superior to them it's crazy ... very easy to open & use, with a VERY STURDY frame, and a much heavier/stronger fabric ... and, it's comfortable, too - I would buy another one in a heartbeat !
customer_reviews.author: J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: A No BS, Wide, Rock Solid, Sleeping Dream.
customer_reviews.text: Dad doing the review here. This thing is the best. Tired of flimsy, overpriced, thinner than a tree branch cots. This is solid, secure, and wide enough to pop a knee out while sleeping. It's firm and i slept great without any wobble or swaying when moving around on it al night. It's not lightweight by any means, but I'm not stressing about the creeping age and long trips hunting and trapping next season. I have been looking for a long time and I'm truly happy with this choice. 2 more on the list to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: The cot tore at the seams the first night. ...
customer_reviews.text: The cot tore at the seams the first night. I weigh 250 and i am 6'2" well within it's weight limits. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: gary gambill

customer_reviews.title: Folds on itself, potential for injury
customer_reviews.text: I had usually used this on carpet and was OK, but the few times that I've tried to use it on flooring, the legs on each end fold in and collapse, potentially causing you to fall. The legs do not lock in place and the feet slip on the floor. Works OK on carpet as the feet catch, but on the bare floor they will slip and cause the legs to fold inwards.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Luis Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Really sturdy well designed cot
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two oversized kamp-rite kwik cots. These cots have a great design & very sturdy construction.If you sit in the middle of the cot they're quite stable. For the price they can't be beat. I like the oversize feature that gives you room to move about on the cot. The cot height works for me & provides ample room underneath to store duffel bags & camping gear. The cot has no center bar, and is firm and supportive. I did purchase two light speed camping mats to make the cot experience more enjoyable. I also purchased the kamp rite quick set table, silver which is well designed and sturdy as well. I highly recommend these Kamp Rite products.
customer_reviews.author: Rich P

customer_reviews.title: Roomy, high up, comfortable (when you add extra padding).
customer_reviews.text: This has been great for using when I have company in my studio apt, and give up my bed. I had a twin size piece of memory foam that I use on top and it's very roomy and comfortable....and it's high up so I'm not crawling out of blow up bed low to the floor. Easy to set up and put away in bag. Wish I thought of it long ago.
customer_reviews.author: PPINNY

customer_reviews.title: It's very comfortable once you get it set up
customer_reviews.text: It's very comfortable once you get it set up. If it is not on flat ground it will sometimes start to fold up while you're sleeping. I'm only 5'2 and it was very difficult to set up and put away by myself. It's pretty heavy but if you're big and strong and have a big enough space for it then this is the cot for you!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine M. Cammack

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy cot
customer_reviews.text: This is our second cot. Kids like the cot in the camper better than the sofa sleeper. A large adult has slept on it just fine. Easy to fold up during day. This second one was sold as used with a blemish on edge but it had never been opened but the box was roughed up pretty good so wouldn't have been very nice looking to give as a gift
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Bad to the Bone for Fatties Like me !!!
customer_reviews.text: Fat Boys this cot is for you. Put a 10inch thick memory foam twin size mattress on it while camping for two weeks in deer season and my 350 pound butt was nice and comfy and slept like a baby. No creaking, No Bowing, No problems of any kind. Rock Damn Solid Cot of Kings. Even used it on a couple weekend fishing trips without the twin mattress on it and it was allot more comfortable than my other fat boy cots from bass pro. I have had it now for almost a year and I will never sleep on another cot unless some thief steals it. Then i'll just buy another of these.
customer_reviews.author: Okie76

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after three days of normal use
customer_reviews.text: The cot looked great initially, aside from being surprisingly tall, which makes it more challenging to get in and out of, but it broke (ripped) on the third night of regular, routine use by a person well under the stated weight limit. It had not been abused or misused, but the canvas shredded at one of the seams. I cannot recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole J.

customer_reviews.title: Nice wide cot!
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact that the cot is wide. Once set up, the cot is very sturdy. You won’t touch the cross rails on this one! I love the fact that you can easily get it back into the carry bag- most when you remove them from the bag, it takes forever to get them back, not this one!
customer_reviews.author: Alvin J.

customer_reviews.title: Great cot
customer_reviews.text: My husband ordered this for himself. Being a big man (around 300lbs) he needed something heavy duty. I had gotten a cheaper one for myself at the store since I’m smaller, however after getting his I returned mine and ordered a second one of these for me. His main complaint about it is they’re a little tall, so when you sit on it, your feet don’t touch the ground....maybe they would if you’re taller. (We’re both under 6’). We will also be adding a pad to ours. All in all, great cot, easy set up/take down. Like the hanging pockets and the extra space it gives underneath verses having an air mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Mindi

customer_reviews.title: ... to sleep on a intex blow up with no joy, keeps deflating
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'5" tall and weigh 300lbs 70 years old sail a 33 ft sailboat and have a small mill shop so I'm not quite a couch potatoe yet been tryin to sleep on a intex blow up with no joy, keeps deflating. have gone thru two of them already. bought the camp rite, and I had a 2 inch foam cushion form from one of the bunks on the boat, made a custom mattress cover for it and it works great on the cot. Plenty of room doesn't wobble around when I flip and flop around, and best part is my feet don't hang off the end of the bed. great choice and buy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: eltombo

customer_reviews.title: Best Cot in this price range.
customer_reviews.text: This cot is easy to open and close, holds lots of weight, long enough for my 6' 2" height, and is sufficiently portable. In this price range, I think this is the best cot on the market.
customer_reviews.author: D. Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Get off the floor
customer_reviews.text: I got the cot for a camping trip because I didn't want to sleep on the ground. I am a pretty large person and the cot worked just fine with my weight. I was able to move around without falling off or feeling like it was going to collapse. It was higher than I expected, when sitting on the cot, my feet dangled slightly but when laying down, I was still able to reach the ground! I slept on top of and in the sleeping bag and that was plenty of cushion, probably would have been fine without. I think it will work perfectly for guests when needed too!
customer_reviews.author: speed reader

customer_reviews.title: Big enough to fit a tent on
customer_reviews.text: Do not underestimate the size of the cot... Or the dark side... I ordered knowing the length would fit the base of my tent but had no clue due to lack of photos on the interwebs just how friggin huge it actually is. It sits taller than my California King, and is longer too. I wish I could have kept it. It's effin comfortable, and fell asleep on it while getting a feel for it. Build quality seemed great, especially for the price. I could see this being perfect for summer camp, family tents for like, one or two people, or spare bed for guests you you don't despise.
customer_reviews.author: Tim S

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for years, and it's holding up great! I'm a big guy, and it holds me up fine. It's very large and takes up a bunch of space, but that is by design, so it's okay. But if you are considering getting it to be a small cot in the corner of the room, be sure to plan for a large corner!
customer_reviews.author: bert

customer_reviews.title: (Almost) Like Home!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AWESOME!!! Bought it for 4 day music festival. I didn't want to bother with an air mattress so I put a $10 egg carton twin mattress pad and a yoga mat down and it was perfect. I was able to sleep through the night without air leaking out and could flip over with ease. Assembly is easy and fast - takes less than five minutes. Will be purchasing more for future camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: tdjangles

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Durable Cot
customer_reviews.text: I love it. it's uber comfortable and quite. My old green got with aluminum frame was very noisy, The Kamp-Rite cot is well designed and sturdy. I'm a stout 220 lb and this cot supports me just fine. I have back problems due to car accidents and this cot doesn't seem to aggravate my back. I highly recommend this cot if you have the space this cot is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: CAL1280

customer_reviews.title: update! does not open it close easily
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED- After over a year of nightly use, it has required only one stitch job. Not to bad for the price. Very breathable. Cheap zippers. Arrived with broken zipper in the carrying bag. Leg attachment appear to have arrived bent or put in wrong. Difficult to open it close one side. Should have bought the cheaper one
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Bark

customer_reviews.title: An oversized sturdy cot good for a big person
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal. An oversized cot for oversized people at a low price. It is sturdy and roomy for my 6'1" 290 pound body. It sets up and takes down in less than a minute. Folds up tightly and has a velcro strap to keep it all folded up nicely. Comes with a sorage bag. Has pockets hanging from the sides.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff O.

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be on carpet
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased with this cot, but about the sixth time we used it, which was on a wood floor, the seam busted and the bottom legs buckled. Not sure which happened first, but it seems as if the legs buckled, which made the seam rip.
customer_reviews.author: Careful Reader

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size & Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Top notch - went on a Missions trip and it was the very best in comfort and very roomy! For the price I paid I should have gotten two, it will work wonderful for overnight guests. It folded up better than everyone elses cot and was easy to carry
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Solid is great, but also means heavy. It is VERY firm. I prefer a soft sleep. I folded a couple of blankets on top, but it is still a hard sleep. We definitely will need to buy some foam. We bought it to try to use at home for guests and car camping, but with the weight and extra padding needed, you would need a lot of space in your vehicle. **warning** there were small scratches on our wood floor after our guests left. It did arrive late, so order early if you need it for an event.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha J

customer_reviews.title: Important to evenly distribute weight?
customer_reviews.text: First one ripped first trip out, however had it easily replaced. So far so good. Bought for my 6'7" 300lb husband. With the second one he also doesn't "sit" on it just lays down to avoid ripping again. So it ripped AGAIN very disappointed. I tried to sleep on it and was worried that I'd fall through!!
customer_reviews.author: N. Houghton

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up.  Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put up/take down and return to its bag. The folded up cot is relatively small for an oversized cot and travels easily. We've used it as an extra bed in a hotel room, or when the weather is hot my kids pull this out into the living room where the air conditioner is. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: They Will Make You Give Up Air Mattresses Forever
customer_reviews.text: So easy to set up, tear down and the size is fantastic. I purchased two for my husband and I and they have been so wonderful. I am done with air mattresses forever. These cots are fantastic. They are very durable and made of high quality material. They are XL, which also means they sit high off the ground. I bought them more for the length and couldn't be more pleased. Not once have I found my pillow on the floor of the tent with these cots. They are heavy, but that's simply because they are such great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable cot but didn't last long !
customer_reviews.text: comfortable cot that only lasted 3 years/Seasons with very little use.. Maybe used it twice a year for a week at a time. Nylon ripped around the seams on the frame ! 6,4 245lb
customer_reviews.author: gary leboff

customer_reviews.title: seams tearing with my 6'3" 150lb son sleeping on it!
customer_reviews.text: Started out ok. It I long like we needed but my 150lb 6'3" son sleeping in it has made the seams start to tear. Not happy with quality at all!
customer_reviews.author: Ketera

customer_reviews.title: comfortable sleep
customer_reviews.text: just got it , set it up once in the house for a test run. This cot set up easy and was surprisingly comfortable with out a pad ( I ordered a pad base on some of the reviews but didn't feel like I needed one . Taking it to a three day reggae festival in two weeks , hope I'm still impressed after using on unlevel ground.
customer_reviews.author: ZACK POWELL

customer_reviews.title: Great cot!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 6'3" son when he comes home. He says it is more comfortable than his mattress. It is well made and easy to put up and then store. My son is very thin and bony, so when he tries to sleep on his sides, he says it is a little uncomfortable. Next time he uses it, we will put a foam mattress topper on it and take care of that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Sags causing back pain
customer_reviews.text: Initially great comfort, But after 4 nights use the canvas sags so much that I hang over the center support with my mid back being forced higher than my feet and head. Now a painful back twister!
customer_reviews.author: Steven R. miler

customer_reviews.title: Good Price.
customer_reviews.text: The cots are sturdy and were easy to set up. They are a little to hard to get off of. I am short so I had some difficulty getting off the cot. You should plan to have some sort of padding to make them a little more comfortable. I am satisfied that it work for what we needed. I would recommend them to others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don't think I could really sleep comfortably on a cot
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I could really sleep comfortably on a cot, but I needed to quarter house guests in a non-bedroom. They were over 6 feet tall and I wanted them to be comfortable. These sounded like they could fulfill my need. I added a double layer of cheap eggcrate mattress foam from Walmart & put a stretch-knit twin sheet over it all. It is wider & longer than any other cot - and higher (okay for tall people). So the pillow does NOT fall off the end! They were very happy with them, saying much better than the floor-level queen bed they formerly used. They are easier to set up too!
customer_reviews.author: utopianna

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for plus size!
customer_reviews.text: I love the stability and easy set up! I used a camping roll on the cot for extra cushion as I have bad hips. It is a bit tricky getting up... I "rolled" in and out of bed and it worked out well! I am so very happy to be tenting again! Love that it has its own carry case! Do yourself a favor and buy this cot!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia C.

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly sturdy, and very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly sturdy, and very comfortable. A little difficult for short people like me to get out of since there is a little give in the center, but not impossible. I wasn't expecting a bag to put it in, so that was an awesome surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Leilani

customer_reviews.title: excellent cot for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've been camping for years this is my first cot. I am 5'2" 120 lbs curvy woman. I tried my boyfriends cot his is an over sized an the fabric is so taught I felt like I was on the ground, mine has a little more give which makes it easier on my curves.i did use a camp pad and a sheet and I felt like a princess. The cot assembled in seconds and its so high all my gear stowed nicely underneath. My boyfriend is 6'2" 250 and he could sleep on it too but it's a little small and not as comfortable for him
customer_reviews.author: Fern Terra

customer_reviews.title: Tore after 7 nights
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cot and used it camping at a music festival for 4 days. It was very comfortable, and it is easy to set up. It didn't last very long though. The following year I brought it again to the music festival and it started ripping. By the 3rd night, I had to sleep very carefully because it had completely torn on the left side. I'm a big guy, but I'm well within the advertised weight it can support. So for the cost and how many nights I got out of it, I wouldn't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: tcooke

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The seams broke as soon as I took it out of the box and laid on it. I went with a thermostat mondo and it is much better
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good night sleep
customer_reviews.text: I’m 6’2 so the average cot is no long enough or wide enough. With that cot my feet don’t hang off the end. It’s also extra wide so you can turn over. The only issue I have found is that it not tight and sagging may be an concern. Overall worth the price
customer_reviews.author: DLH, Wilson nc

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.  Very versitile.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased one of these for guests to use, and liked it so well that when we moved and were between selling our old house and building a new one (during which time we crashed temporarily in my in-law's bottom level of their house), we purchased a second one to use as our kid's beds as they took up much less space and were easier to move than their bulky bunk bed is. I love that they are oversized, so my very tall husband can comfortably sleep on it when he needs a bed for overnight fishing trips. It's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 5 camping trips then the plastic parts started to break.
customer_reviews.author: R. Beach

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Spent several nights on this and slept better than I thought I would. I'm 6'7" and 310lbs. It feels plenty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: not a good long term product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year for camping with my sons scout pack. after 2 2 day camp outs and then 1 week for him at camp and the material just shredded and one end has a giant hole. I loved the ease of putting it up but it sucks that it only lasted 3 camping trips and so I wouldn't buy this one again
customer_reviews.author: T C Amlin

customer_reviews.title: Large, comfy, portable.
customer_reviews.text: Larger than I expected but happy about it. Fit in my 8 person tent. Big enough for an average size adult and small child or baby side sleeping if going family camping. Kept me off the cold ground. If you could find a piece of foam to lay on top it'd be like you never left your bed behind. Easy to fold up and comes with a carrying case. I'm very happy for the price!
customer_reviews.author: adrienne v.

customer_reviews.title: ... and I purchased 2 of these based on the excellent reviews but were unable to use them because of ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I purchased 2 of these based on the excellent reviews but were unable to use them because of excessive sagging. I suppose they would be ok if you don't mind being confined in a "hammock like" cot, but I like to change sleeping positions and would not be able to do so in this cot. I weigh 170 lbs. and my wife is 110 lbs. so I don't think our weight was the problem. We did find other cots that were more difficult to assemble, but also had much less sag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great size, but I only used this a few ...
customer_reviews.text: Great size, but I only used this a few times and the stitching started to come undone. Now it's unusable. Since it's been so long I can't do anything about it. Too bad, everything is still new.
customer_reviews.author: Edward L. Scheinbach

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love these! Only minor issue.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these! Incredibly comfortable and I love that it's so long because both myself and my husband are tall. My husband is 6' 2" and he fits on the body of the bed from head to toe, no feet dangling off! My only wish was that the legs locked into place when it's set up. They fold very easily when you nug the kot just moving around the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Casey C

customer_reviews.title: Durable, extra-long, and comfy as cots go!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Very durable, extra-long cot. Nice width, too. It’s great for camping, but we’ve used it several times since purchase in our home for guests and once on a mission trip. Have to admit that it a little heavy if you have to carry it very far, though. Definitely pleased with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: V.L.B

customer_reviews.title: Lasted for only a few days before ripping
customer_reviews.text: I chose this product because it received good ratings. We put it in storage until we needed it (about a year later.) Unfortunately, it lasted for only a few days. After a couple of days, the fabric stretched and sunk eventually tearing away from the frame. The good news is that the first day or so, it was very comfortable. Too bad it didn't last.
customer_reviews.author: Mary L.

customer_reviews.title: not bad! Slept pretty well
customer_reviews.text: BIG Cot! Very long. Be sure to measure your tent to make sure it will fit. It is also VERY high off the ground. I'm 6 ft and when I sit on the edge of cot I can't touch the ground. You have to sit ON the side bar to touch ground. Comfort..not bad! Slept pretty well. Like the NO bars across head or feet.. Only complaint is that the ends do NOT seem to lock when open. Feels like ends could fold accidentally if pushed the right way. Still, a great investment for home and tent...if it fits. Nice carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Grey

customer_reviews.title: Great for tall people
customer_reviews.text: Great size and pretty tall. Its comfy even without a sleep pad but I need the pad for warmth. 5nights camping and it held up great. The ground had a bit of a slope so we had to be careful with the legs as moving it could cause them to fold. Even so it was better than the yoller cot that bent on day 2
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: Large and comfy
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Cot is large and comfortable. Two issues previously mentioned. 1. I am 6 feet one inch and sitting on the cot feet do not quite touch the ground. Dropping the height 2 or 3 inches would be better design. However under cot is good storage space for gear. 2. Nearly impossible to put cot back in storage bag. Making bag a little larger would be simple and minimal incremental cost. Good for car camping or for extra bedding. I slept on it with no padding as it was a hot night. Comfortable,stable, no squeaking. Would buy again if it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: mdm

customer_reviews.title: Great Cot!
customer_reviews.text: It seems everything we get from Amazon is great! I just read the reviews and check for the most starred products! Love this for camping and when the grandkids come over. They feel like they are camping out! LOL Would definitely purchase another. Made well and very supportive. Easy to put up as well. A good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fondaw

customer_reviews.title: ... had this for about a month and it's a great buy so far
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a month and it's a great buy so far. very sturdy, very comfortable, but just a tiny bit awkward to set up. Very easy to set up and break down with two people but otherwise itll take a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought it in February 2019 and didn’t use it until to now June 2019 for 11 year old grandson. 3 nights and one side is ripped. Too late to send it back
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: used 5 times seam tore down the middle
customer_reviews.text: went camping on this approx. 5 times, not long trips, an a seam down the middle split. of course it was out of warentee. i do not recommend this. as it tore so easily. easy to put up and take down, actually fit in the included bag when i put it away. a little stiff to sleep on, i am tall and it is plenty long enough. it was a little high off the ground to get off of gracefully a
customer_reviews.author: kathy p

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to buy this to take the wife out to camp out on the ice it worked pretty good though fabric was taking a toll from being cold and then warm from heater.
customer_reviews.author: fong yang

customer_reviews.title: Bigg & Tall
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cot. Well made, pretty heavy duty, holds my 260+, 5'11 frame every night for 60 days straight, no squeaks and plenty of room to stretch out. Attached pockets on side hold my cell phone and glasses, separately, and more. And, just as several others have mentioned, it is kinda high, which makes it fun to get out of since your feet don't touch the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T. Oakey

customer_reviews.title: Good for larger people or those wanting extra room
customer_reviews.text: Used for camping at a boy scout summer camp. At over 300 pounds I found this cot to stand up well to the week of sleeping on it. Provided a comfortable sleeping condition that was spacious despite my oversided frame.
customer_reviews.author: Higosha

customer_reviews.title: Stitching ripped out first time I used it
customer_reviews.text: I’m disappointed. This cot got great reviews on other sites as well as Amazon. Mine arrived today. I took it out of the box, opened it up and the first time I laid down on it the stitching along the side started ripping out. I’m nowhere near the weight capacity of 350 lbs. It will be returned to Amazon tomorrow and I’ll be going with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Set up is easy
customer_reviews.text: Folds up and set up is very easy. Husband says it is comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I got this because it takes up less space than my Tent Cot when folded. Very sturdy and comfortable. Taller than most cots, which makes it a little harder to get in and out of the cot.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: easy set up and take down
customer_reviews.text: Quality construction, easy set up and take down, easy to carry around. Large enough for my 250 lb. frame and long enough for my 6 foot body. If you were 6'4" it would still fit great. You need to out a pad under you for comfort but it's not bad just the way it is.
customer_reviews.author: maxx12

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend or buy again...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for deer camping... The frame is rugged and very heavy, but the fabric seam pulled loose and tore making it unusable. Would not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Catfish19

customer_reviews.title: A Good Nights Rest
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding Cot. While I haven't used it camping just yet, I have used it here at home along with the Kamp Rite Single Self Inflating Pad. Very comfortable and stows nicely. I had been using Cabela's Super Lounger and it is heavy and takes longer to set up and take down and takes up far more space when I'm packing all of my camping gear. This cot is awesome. Very happy with it and the pad.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: We camp a lot and bought this for my wife. Comfy and well built. Gets her off the ground. Just have to buy one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Paquin

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty great item
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty great item. I'm a plus sized person and was wanting something very sturdy. I took the cot camping and set it up in the tent. The thing is huge. It's very long and sits up very high. It takes up a lot of space in the tent and a lot of space in the car. It was very comfortable to sleep on, but it's huge to carry. It might be better in a home where you need an extra occasional bed.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: This just came today and I am very pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.text: This just came today and I am very pleased with purchase. Very easy to set up and took only minutes. This is a BIG cot! It will be perfect for extra bed for guests next week. I will add a mattress pad that I already had. Note, I am close to 5'!!' and my feet did not really reach the floor. You may need to be able to climb out. Otherwise there is plenty of room to roll over and stretch out. Folds up and into carrying case easily.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Littleton

customer_reviews.title: Big cot for real men!
customer_reviews.text: This cot is huge! I am not a fat guy at all. I am 6'-6" and 250. It is plenty big for me. Bigger than I expected and super easy to set up. Not heavier than other oversize cots, and better make than the one I was checking at my favorite Bass amateur shop. Bottom line, it kept me off the ground, compacts to a good size, has a carry bag, and withstood the weight and size of me.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: I have this "bed"  for one year now
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camping cot for use it like my bed last year September 9 2013, now is September 20 2014 , I used it every day, for sleep and take a nap, I'm overweight 260 pounds and the cot still very strong and comfortable. Also I want to mention that I use every day just with sheets, I never put something else on it like air path or memory foam path. Really I'm very happy with this cot, I hope can use it for another year every day, also is very fresh in the summer just with the sheets.
customer_reviews.author: Carmín Triviño

customer_reviews.title: A very comfortable camping cot
customer_reviews.text: A very comfortable camping cot, well constructed and not liable to break the first time use use it, putting it up is a easy and although the legs don't lock, once in position they don't move. I was able to move in the cot with out fear of the the cot rolling over. the only disappointment was that the carrying bag zipper is worse than useless and broke on the second time I tried to close the cot in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: This is a great cot! I bought my kids and my wife ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cot! I bought my kids and my wife cots too but this bad boy is for me! It's very comfy and gives me space to toss and turn without having to bother with a deflated air mattress. It's surprisingly light for how large it is. The bag that it comes with is well built and easy to use. Wrapping up and setting up the cot is trivial and requires no special skills or strength.
customer_reviews.author: Ariashaka

customer_reviews.title: defective product do not buy this , super disappointed in Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This item is built defective and two of the end swivel pieces were assembled backward causing product failure. The u shaped offset brackets are ok on one side, and on the other side where the u shapped brackets were assembled backwards they collide with the nylock insert lock nuts. If the u shaped swivel brackets were assembled correctly this would will allow proper clearance of u shaped bracket to pass the nylock hex nuts. this is a defective product that should have been put through proper quality control, and should have never been sold to consumers. deeply disappointed as i do not use this product everyday and did not notice it right away
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Large and comfortable but has some cheap plastic pieces.
customer_reviews.text: The large width allows for comfortable positioning throughout the night. The surface is firm and supportive. One of the plastic pieces that wraps around one of the metal legs was cracked when first taken out of the box but has not prevented the cot from being used.
customer_reviews.author: Kliff

customer_reviews.title: Very big!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cot, but listen to the reviews about it being XL! No joke!
customer_reviews.author: jennifer king

customer_reviews.title: Good one
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cot! Easy set up and take down. It’s comfortable but would be better with a cot pad if you’re using it for a extended time. It’s a longer and wider cot than others so it’s hard to find a pad that fits this one. But my son is 6’2” and he was comfortable on this cot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful cot!
customer_reviews.text: I loved sleeping on this cot! Big and pretty comfortable! Easy to open and close! Nice to have as an extra hotel bed, for camping or if we have an unexpected guest at home. Purchased for camping - air mattresses just don't hold up!
customer_reviews.author: CMS

customer_reviews.title: Cot
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for camping and when guests come over. I just put a foam mattress on it for a little more comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Royal D. Whetstone Jr.

customer_reviews.title: nice cot!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, this is a fairly large cot. Comfort wise is very good, since there are no cross braces, the cot seemed to dip in the center. Also I stand 6'1 and sitting on the cot, my feet doesn't touch the ground. So if your putting on shoes, u might want to move to a chair as this cot sits very high. Overall very comfy cot when used with a pad.
customer_reviews.author: 77Chargers

customer_reviews.title: Everything as advertised. My only issue is just the ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything as advertised. My only issue is just the comfort - which is just with a cot in general i do believe. You really can't sleep on your side and you do tend to fall into a valley vs. it being completely flat. These issues however are mine and not necessarily what the general public might experience.
customer_reviews.author: Matty Mo

customer_reviews.title: good size
customer_reviews.text: This is plenty big and comfortable as long as you are not expecting it to feel like a bed. I would recommend this for guests any time, it is a bit heavy for camping. I would not like to have to drag this out to a camping spot.
customer_reviews.author: Coi

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The width is perfect. Comfortable. Side pockets are nice. Cons: Heavy to lug around (should have used lighter medal legs). Not as easy to snap together as previously mentioned. Almost too long unless you're 6'4"+. . . I guess your dog could sleep at your feet.
customer_reviews.author: KLPW

customer_reviews.title: Really Oversized !
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, but unconventional size. Twice as tall and longer than my other cots. too large for small tents 6x10 or smaller. More like a hammock than a cot.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: he says it was very comfortable and worked just fine for him
customer_reviews.text: got this one for my husband and he is 5'11" and 238 pounds. he says it was very comfortable and worked just fine for him. we went camping for five days in a row and we are very delighted with the performance. we both highly recommend both of these.. NO MORE AIR BEDS FOR US,DARN TIRED OF THEM GOING FLAT ALL THE TIME...THANK YOU VERY MUCH
customer_reviews.author: Anita Mehaffey

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and stable
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge, just so you know. I'm 315 lbs. and this thing supports me no problem. Comfortable and stable. The one thing that is tricky is getting out of it. It does sit pretty high and you have to swing your legs over the edge and rock up.
customer_reviews.author: THREE BOY DAD

customer_reviews.title: Skip it.
customer_reviews.text: Our guests said it felt like laying in a firm hammock. When i tried it out i was disappoonted to habe to agree. Its not tight enough to prevent bowing like a hammock. We ended up having to sell it off of craigslist.
customer_reviews.author: k_luss

customer_reviews.title: It's heavy
customer_reviews.text: Seriously not a 600lb sustained weigh capacity. Maybe 315. I slept 8 nights in the mountains on it. I weigh 315 it didn't rip but did say more than I would have liked
customer_reviews.author: Lurch

customer_reviews.title: Bad stitching
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this since 2016 indint start using it until 2018 and have only used it 5 times and this morning the seems where the frame meets the fabric ripped loose I am camping for another 3 weeks this is a less than ideal situation
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Gorton

customer_reviews.title: Big and heavy. Areo Bed slides around on it ...
customer_reviews.text: Big and heavy. Areo Bed slides around on it a lot. Difficult to open and close. Functional, when you overcome the issues. Don't fall out! With an air mattress on it, it's very high, I'm 6'1" and my feet don't touch the ground when sitting on it.Get a big tent. It takes up a lot of space in my 4 man.
customer_reviews.author: robert A.

customer_reviews.title: Large enough for side sleepers
customer_reviews.text: Took it out a couple of weekends ago for a weekend camping trip. I"m 6'1" and weigh 240 lbs. Very durable, slept very well. I do recommend some type of sleeping pad on top for those who do not like hard beds. Kept cool during overnight temps of 80 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Superb! Long enough so the pillow doesn't fall off during sleep. Very wide. Can roll over. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Man McG

customer_reviews.title: Good, but...
customer_reviews.text: First off let me say that, "This product is exactly what it claims to be and of good quality". That said, while this is an "XL sized" cot it is very difficult for an XL sized person to get out of. It sets a little bit to high off the ground and you tend to sink into while sitting on the edge to make a quick exit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable cot!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. Before we had a bunch of WW II cots that were ok, but these are fantastic!!! Everyone in my family loves them and what I need to do is buy about 3-4 more. One thing that's a slight annoyance is that they are a little hard to get back in the bags, but other than that, these are the best cots I've ever slept in!
customer_reviews.author: Andy

product_meta.title: Kamp-Rite Oversize Kwik Cot
product_meta.description: The Kamp-Rite oversize Kwik cot opens in seconds to create a comfortable 84" x 33" sleeping surface the oversize Kwik cot folds down to a compact 43" x 10" x 9" package. W.Eight capacity 350 lbs.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
